## What is GWalkR?

-   GWalkR is an R package that is used to simplify explanatory data analysis and data visualization.

-   Replicates a majority of the features used by the data visualization software Tableau but in the R universe.

-   The package only contains three main functions

## What is Tableau?

-   Tableau is a software tool targeted at Data Analysts, Sales people, marketing agents who do not have experience in SQL, Alteryx, or R studio.

-   Tableau is praised for its smooth automation and its ability to easily integrate data.

-   Used by a wide variety of company's in varying number of fields

## What does GWalkR do?

-   Creates a very similar interactive interface where the user can alter the visualizations however they see fit.
-   Has the ability for users to drag and drop variables into the GWalkR environment and easily create charts and graphs.
-   A large variety of visualization options so the user can get the visualization that best showcases there data.

## Code in Action (gwalkr)

This is the main function in the package that launches the interactive interface.

``` r
library(GWalkR)
data(iris)
gwalkr(iris)
```

## GWalkR Code in Action

**(gwalkrOutput and renderGwalkr)**

These are two other functions in the package that help incorporate the GWalkR interface into Shiny apps.

``` r
#gwalkrOutput
gwalkrOutput(outputId, width = "100%", height = "100%")

#renderGwalkr
renderGwalkr(expr, env = parent.frame(), quoted = FALSE)
```
